hypothesis_content.title: Stress Regime Dominance Spike Failure at 65% Resistance
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes (VIX > 25, crypto vol > 80%), if BTC dominance rallies to test the 65% level but fails to close above it for 2 consecutive days while BTC perpetual funding turns negative, dominance will reverse sharply as forced altcoin selling exhausts and BTC safe-haven flows stall.
hypothesis_content.rationale: 65% represents extreme psychological resistance where previous bear market peaks formed. During stress events, altcoins experience forced selling first, pushing dominance higher. When BTC funding turns negative at this level, it suggests even BTC longs are capitulating, creating exhaustion. The reversal is amplified by altcoin short-covering.
entry_conditions: Market regime = STRESS (confirmed by regime classifier)
Two consecutive daily closes below 65% after testing
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Dominance breaks and holds above 65% with positive BTC funding, indicating genuine flight-to-safety rather than temporary stress.
